metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10900 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Network Manager VPNC plugin (aka networkmanager-vpnc) before version 1.2.6is vulnerable to a privilege escalation attack. A new line character can beused to inject a Password helper parameter into the configuration datapassed to VPNC, allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary commands as root.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

network-manager-vpnc - 1.1.93-1ubuntu0.1
network-manager-vpnc-gnome - 1.1.93-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: network-manager-vpnc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.93-1ubuntu0.1').
